text: Martin Schindler (born 16 August 1996) is a German professional darts player who plays in Professional Darts Corporation (PDC) events. ==Career== Schindler won a PDC Tour Card at Qualifying-School (Q-School) in January 2017. He represented Germany along with Max Hopp at the 2017 PDC World Cup of Darts, reaching the quarter-finals, before losing to the Dutch pair of Michael van Gerwen and Raymond van Barneveld. ==World Championship results== ===PDC=== * 2018: 1st Round (lost to Simon Whitlock 1–3) * 2019: 1st Round (lost to Cody Harris 2–3) ==Performance timeline== {| class="wikitable" style="width:30%; margin:0" |- !
